result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew Lawrence Sobczak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All court obligations for Ct 1 shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court. Court waives court obligations for Ct 2.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall have such assessments, treatment, counseling and programming as DOC deems appropriate.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew Lawrence Sobczak

records.addlTxt: cc'd def. 10/10/22 jk
for payment of legal fees

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Andrew Lawrence Sobczak in court.  Attorney Tripp Stroud in court for Andrew Lawrence Sobczak.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend Ct 1 to disorderly conduct. Per agreement, defendant will plead to both counts. State will recommend 1 year probation with the following conditions: to participate in counseling that DOC deems appropriate, pay court costs, and to provide a DNA sample. Court grants amendment to Ct 1. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads guilty to Cts 1 and 2. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. State heard. Attorney Stroud heard. Defendant is heard. Court heard and orders 1 year probation with the following conditions: to have such assessment, treatment, counseling, and programming that DOC deems appropriate, to pay costs on Ct 1 and costs for Ct 2 are waived, and to provide a DNA sample.
Status conference on September 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Andrew Lawrence Sobczak in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tripp Stroud in court for Andrew Lawrence Sobczak. State heard in opposition to motion to dismiss charges. Court heard. Motion to dismiss Count 2 denied. Attorney Stroud heard. Court heard. Motion to dismiss Count 1 denied. Bindover is appropriate. Count 2 is related to spouse. State may be filing other acts motion.

Defendant Andrew Lawrence Sobczak in court.  Attorney Lisa Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tripp Stroud in court for Andrew Lawrence Sobczak.  Attorney Stroud filed a motion this morning. Defendant waives formal reading and pleads not guilty to charges. Motion and status hearings set.
Motion hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Motion hearing on July 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
to Dismiss
Garnishment Papers
Preliminary hearing 5-31-2022
Arraignment on June 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Andrew Lawrence Sobczak in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tripp Stroud in court for Andrew Lawrence Sobczak. Travis Dregne sworn and testified. Cross. Attorney Pozorksi heard and requests bind over. Attorney Stroud heard and objects to bind over. Attorney Pozorski heard on social worker's report. Court heard and binds matter over. Information filed. Arraignment date set.
Arraignment scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Andrew Lawrence Sobczak in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Petition for counsel offered and reviewed by court. Court appoints Attorney Stroud. Court orders repayment of $50 biweekly by wage assignment. Defendant referred to judicial assistant. Wage assignment to be arranged and preliminary hearing to be set.
Status conference on May 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew Lawrence Sobczak in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for SPD. Defendant needs to try to retain an attorney before court will appoint one. State requests signature bond with a condition to cooperate with safety plan. Court orders $500 signature bond with condition to comply with safety plan set up by Social Services. Status set.
DEFENDANT SHALL COMPLY WITH SAFETY PLAN SET UP BY SOCIAL SERVICES.
